title: Comparative Study on the Effectiveness of Experiment Design-Based Learning Facilitation Techniques

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary mathematics education experience and understanding of basic experimental design methodologies
context.additional_context: Targeting in-service secondary mathematics teachers, considering learner characteristics from diverse socioeconomic backgrounds

learning_goals: Experimental designs (e.g., between-group vs within-group) can be applied to compare the effectiveness of various learning facilitation techniques
Differences in the effectiveness of learning facilitation techniques based on learner characteristics (socioeconomic background, cognitive abilities) can be analyzed
Instructional strategies can be improved and incorporated into lesson designs based on formative assessment results
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
